isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - ENGINE CONTROL SYSTEM OVERVIEW - DIAGNOSTIC SOFTWARE OPERATION - Service Procedure

svcsubproc.title: Key-On Engine Running Injector Test

note.para: The Key-On Engine Running Standard Test must be done before starting the Key-On Engine Running Injector Test.

svcsubproc.para: The Key-On Engine Running Injector Test (Cylinder Contribution Test) detects injection and combustion problems. This test analyzes the individual contribution of each fuel injector and problems that can affect overall performance of the power cylinders (i.e. valves, push rods, pistons, rings, etc.).

During this test, the ECM controls fuel delivery and determines the power contribution for each cylinder. If a cylinder is not performing satisfactorily, a DTC will be set in severe cases; but if a misfire occurs the DTC will not be set.
This procedure done in numerical order, beginning with cylinder 1 and ending with cylinder 6.

step1.para: Select Key-On Engine Running Injector Test from the Diagnostics Drop-Down Menu.
When this test begins engine rpm increases in increments of 850 rpm.
The ECM will increase the normal amount of fuel delivery (overfuel) to the injector of the cylinder being tested.
The ECM monitors the reduction of fuel required to operate the other 5 injectors to maintain a constant speed.

Then the ECM limits the fuel delivery (underfuel) to the same injector and monitors the increase in fuel delivery to other 5 injectors. The ECM compares the fuel delivery during overfuel to fuel delivery change (underfuel). If the difference or change is not what the ECM expects, the ECM will set a code (in severe cases) for the non-contributing cylinder.

note.para: On engines with more than one severely scuffed injector, rpm fluctuation can stop the cylinder contribution test.
